channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: SCOTUS case could expand presidential powers. And, Dems pitch plan for ACA subsidies
item.description: The Supreme Court will hear arguments today in a case about President Trump's firing of a Federal Trade Commissioner. And, Senate Democrats are set to pitch a plan to extend ACA subsidies this week.
item.content:encoded:
The Supreme Court will hear arguments today in a case about President Trump's firing of a Federal Trade Commissioner. And, Senate Democrats are set to pitch a plan to extend ACA subsidies this week.

(Image credit: David Becker)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: After Texas ruling, Trump and Republicans head to 2026 with a redistricting edge
item.description: Trump has prompted a redistricting race as he tries to maintain Republican control of the House in the 2026 elections. Democrats have fewer options to counter, as the battle heads into next year.
item.content:encoded: Trump has prompted a redistricting race as he tries to maintain Republican control of the House in the 2026 elections. Democrats have fewer options to counter, as the battle heads into next year.
item.dc:creator: Larry Kaplow

item.title: How China, not the U.S., became the main climate solution story in 2025
item.description: The U.S. has become a "side character" in the global story of renewable energy, experts say. China dominates the sector, with positive implications for the climate and their economy.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. has become a "side character" in the global story of renewable energy, experts say. China dominates the sector, with positive implications for the climate and their economy.

(Image credit: Julia Simon)
item.dc:creator: Julia Simon

item.title: Zelenskyy heads to London for more Ukraine peace talks. Here's what to know
item.description: The talks signal fresh support from European allies. But they follow stalled U.S. negotiations in Miami and comments from President Trump's son suggesting Washington is ready to pull back.
item.content:encoded:
The talks signal fresh support from European allies. But they follow stalled U.S. negotiations in Miami and comments from President Trump's son suggesting Washington is ready to pull back.

(Image credit: WPA Pool)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: Republicans push high deductible plans and health savings accounts
item.description: A Republican call to give Americans cash instead of health insurance subsidies revives an old idea that has left millions with medical debt.
item.content:encoded:
A Republican call to give Americans cash instead of health insurance subsidies revives an old idea that has left millions with medical debt.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Noam Levey

item.title: Does one drink make you dizzy? Why alcohol hits us harder as we age
item.description: For many people, the holidays mean more parties and more occasions to drink. But if you've noticed that one cocktail hits you harder than it used to, there's a scientific reason to explain it.
item.content:encoded:
For many people, the holidays mean more parties and more occasions to drink. But if you've noticed that one cocktail hits you harder than it used to, there's a scientific reason to explain it.

(Image credit: Cappi Thompson)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: Supreme Court to hear case that could vastly expand presidential powers
item.description: The Supreme Court hears arguments in a case about President Trump's firing of a Federal Trade Commissioner. At stake is a 90-year precedent limiting the president's power over independent agencies.
item.content:encoded:
The Supreme Court hears arguments in a case about President Trump's firing of a Federal Trade Commissioner. At stake is a 90-year precedent limiting the president's power over independent agencies.

(Image credit: Elizabeth Gillis)
item.dc:creator: Alyssa Kapasi

item.title: Morning new brief
item.description: SCOTUS to hear case that could extend presidential powers, Senate expected to vote this week on ACA subsidy extension plan, Zelenskyy to meet with European leaders amid pressure to accept peace plan.
item.content:encoded: SCOTUS to hear case that could extend presidential powers, Senate expected to vote this week on ACA subsidy extension plan, Zelenskyy to meet with European leaders amid pressure to accept peace plan.
item.dc:creator: A Mart√≠nez

item.title: Tributes, not politics, play center stage as Trump hosts the Kennedy Center Honors
item.description: President Trump said he was closely involved with picking the honorees, and on Sunday he became the first president to host the Kennedy Center awards ceremony.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump said he was closely involved with picking the honorees, and on Sunday he became the first president to host the Kennedy Center awards ceremony.

(Image credit: Kevin Wolf/AP)
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: Thailand launches airstrikes along border with Cambodia as tensions reignite
item.description: Both sides accused the other of breaking a ceasefire that halted fighting earlier this year. Longstanding border disputes erupted into five days of combat in July that killed dozens.
item.content:encoded:
Both sides accused the other of breaking a ceasefire that halted fighting earlier this year. Longstanding border disputes erupted into five days of combat in July that killed dozens.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: Michael Sullivan
